page.title: 09Traffic Survey
page.content: On Tuesday 2nd July we carried out a traffic survey of the main{A 24 road. We made{5 counts}in all at two hourly intervals from 8.30 a.m. to 4.30 p.m. We counted the traffic in quarter hourly sessions and then multiplied by 4 to give the hourly flow of traffic. We split each count into four groups: cars; buses and coaches; lorries and vans; bicycles and motor cycles. The{8.30 a.m. count}proved the {busiest}with a total hourly rate of 2,032 vehicles, 1,036 of which were passenger cars travelling to Horsham and probably people on their way to work. By 12.30 p.m. the rate had dropped to 1,020 vehicles an hour but by the start of the evening 'rush hour' at 4.30 p.m. the rate was up to 1708 an hour again. We all felt a {by-pass}for Ashington is long overdue.
